ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would definitely recommend the class to a fellow student, as a great introductory course to sex and gender sociology but also as a good class to strengthen any knowledge of the field that the student might have.

I would recommend SOCY 523 to graduate students, noting that it is an excellent course for gaining a foundational understanding of sociology of gender literature across a variety of topics, such as sex and gender theory, gender inequality in the workplace, gender and markets, gender and families, etc.
I would recommend this class without reservation for anyone interested in qualitative research, gender, or sociology in general.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I did not have any knowledge of the discipline when I joined the class, and I have gained a strong understanding of the field and the issues involved in discussions about sex and gender as social constructed concepts.
Excellent auxilliary information on interview techniques, the presentation of knowledge, honing a research question, organizing findings, and coding of research.
